data.title: Fix MAD Tank command bar deploy.
data.body: Fixes #13698 and the missing tooltip description.

data.title: ADD closeEnoughDist parameter to Enter activity
data.body:
A generalization for Enter activity.

It now takes one more parameter of closeEnoughDistance to allow something to enter the target while the target is moving. There's no real use in bundled mods but a good use is the Aircraft Carrier logic.

https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/13126 : Neater than the previous attempt.

data.title: QTNK (RA1) doesn't deploy with F key
data.body: I think this is an inconsistency when DTRK can be deployed with F key.

data.title: Removed references to make docs
data.body:
#13682  

I removed the leftover reference as requested.

data.title: Disable bots on Poland Raid (again)
data.body:
Closes  #13661.

For some reason, the changes of #6215 were reverted.

data.title: Remove TargetWhenIdle and TargetWhenDamaged from AutoTarget
data.body: Those were just bogus/unnecessary and are now replaced by using `InitialStance` (and `EnableStances: false`).

data.title: Building Footprint still bugged
data.body:
When a building spawns another building via trait/code whatsoever
the Footprint gets messed up and "=" footrint completly ignored.

data.title: Fix explosion effects on trees
data.body:
I forgot that trees don't have the Ground TargetType (to make them invulnerable to everything but flame weapons) when refactoring the effect warhead.

Fixes #13686.

data.title: Improve the exception message when a Bridge's DemolishWeapon cannot be found
data.body: Closes #13690

data.title: Improve the exception message when a Bridge's DemolishWeapon cannot be found
Can't install Tiberian Dawn
data.body:
I am trying to install the content for Tiberian Dawn from my original C&C discs. I inserted Disc 1, clicked advanced install and had it detect the disc. It detects the disc, and I clicked the button to install the content. Then I got an error saying to check install.log. Here is the install.log

```
Copying F:\.\CONQUER.MIX -> C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/conquer.mix
Copying F:\.\DESERT.MIX -> C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/desert.mix
Copying F:\.\GENERAL.MIX -> C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/general.mix
Copying F:\.\SCORES.MIX -> C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/scores.mix
Copying F:\.\SOUNDS.MIX -> C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/sounds.mix
Copying F:\.\TEMPERAT.MIX -> C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/temperat.mix
Copying F:\.\WINTER.MIX -> C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/winter.mix
Extracting F:\INSTALL/SETUP.Z -> C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/speech.mix
System.IO.InvalidDataException: Invalid dictionary size
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.Blast.Decompress(Stream input, Stream output, Action`2 onProgress)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.Logic.InstallFromDiscLogic.ExtractFromPackage(ExtractionType type, String path, MiniYaml actionYaml, List`1 extractedFiles, Action`1 updateMessage)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.Logic.InstallFromDiscLogic.<InstallFromDisc>c__AnonStorey5.<>m__1()
Deleting C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/conquer.mix
Deleting C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/desert.mix
Deleting C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/general.mix
Deleting C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/scores.mix
Deleting C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/sounds.mix
Deleting C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/temperat.mix
Deleting C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/winter.mix
Deleting C:\Users\Brandon\Documents\OpenRA\Content/cnc/speech.mix
```

I tried Googling the error in the log and didn't find anything relevant. I am using OpenRA 20170527 on Windows 10 15063.483 64-bit.  The discs are US English discs. Both the front cover of the jewel case and the discs say Windows 95 under the Command & Conquer logo if that means something.

data.title: TransformOnCapture plays sell animations
data.body: The new transform activity code plays sell animation all the time, even when SkipMakeAnims == true (by default). Considering sell and make are different things I think there should be SkipSellAnims option as well.

data.title: Hunt activity multiple attack base support
data.body: It seems the engine is moving towards multiple attack base support. Hunt.cs used by Lua scripting side is lagging behind this.

data.title: Shooting on tree shows no explosion effect (Playtest-20170722)
data.body:
Verified on the fresh installation of the new Playtest.

Force firing cannon shells onto a live tree (not burnt ones) shows no weapon FX and feels very odd.

data.title: ReturnToBase is queued TWICE in Playtest-20170722
data.body:
Unlike previous releases, if you press F,
* new IssueDeployOrder in Aircraft.cs queues ReturnToBase. (New code in Playtest)
* UnitCommandWidget.cs PerformDeploy then queues "ReturnToBase" order.

It might mess up reservation stuff. It definitely messes stuff up in my current branch where I'm unifying all the dock activities and multi-dock stuff.

data.title: Refactor BurstDelay to BurstDelays, supporting per-burst delays
data.body:
Closes #13683.

~Depends on #13597.~

data.title: Support per-burst BurstDelays

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
Original TS engine 2.x (2.x patch, Firestorm) added support for BurstDelay0-4, allowing to define individual delays for bursts 2-6.

In our case, I'd turn `int BurstDelay` into `int[] BurstDelays`. For individual delays modders will have to define the whole list of delays (i.e. if `Burst: 6` where delay between 2nd and 3rd and 4th & 5th should be 10 and 5 between all other bursts, it would have to be `BurstDelays: 5, 10, 5, 10, 5`).
For convenience, if only a single value is defined it will be used for all bursts.

I have a branch for this, but it's based and therefore depends on #13597.

Needed to bring Juggernaut even closer to original (first 2 bursts almost simultaneously, 3rd with some more delay).

data.title: Makefile header still refers to `make docs` which no longer exists
[Playtest 20170722] Auto attack issues
data.body:
The items I found to be an issue in the latest playtest:

- Auto attack, they often stop going to target, standing idle in the middle of the map, or after attacking a unit, they won't keep on going to their auto attack target, totally forgetting their mission.
- New units are always created with the default option "not attacking buildings". It would be great to also be able to set the state of the creation buildings, because I want them to attack buildings. I often forgot to change it and then they stand idle in a base and in the end the AI wins there from those troops. Same for attacking with base building, units are created but they don't attack the building next to them.
- Airplanes when you want to group them to a location, they just fly away again, not possible to keep a large group of airlpanes grouped on a location anymore.
- Airplanes when auto attack just fly sometimes home with still ammo available (A new panic feature where they run from war ? ;-)  )
- Airplanes with auto attack often circle with lots of attack targets, but not picking one, or they picked one but unable to reach it in their current circle and they keep circling it.

data.title: [RA] Revert 4 cell adjacency of Kennel/Silo back to 2.
data.body:
Fixes #13656

Unforeseen consequence of #13640. The change was supposed to add a level of convenience but risks distorting maps that depend on players not having access to certain part of the maps. E.g. Kennel granting the dog access to restricted areas. Silo having the feature standalone is probably unwanted.

data.title: Bump minimum mono version to 4.6 on macOS
data.body:
See discussion in #13478.

  1. Update https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRALauncherOSX/
  2. Update macOS packaging to use the updated launcher tag.

data.title: Counterstrike and Aftermath not imported from The First Decade DVD
data.body: Is there a reason for this?

data.title: Use strafing for RA Yak - 2nd attempt
data.body:
The primary (balancing) issue of the first attempt was that syncing the impact offsets with the Yak's speed - to replicate the original game's behavior - resulted in too large gaps between shots, reducing pin-point damage too much.

The original behavior was not necessarily realistic either, since Yaks would have to tip their nose to shoot at ground targets, which would result in more 'compressed' impact range as well.

For now, I've made the damage more focused by reducing the distance between impacts from 342 to 256 WDist (about 2 pixels vertically or horizontally on the map), which - combined with the other damage tweaks I previously made - just might be enough already.

I was able to kill two artilleries in a row with some quick clicking on the 2nd.

This might need further fine-tuning of course, but by no longer sticking to 100%-RA1 style strafing, balancing this properly should be doable.

data.title: Setting to disable the command bar (visually)
data.body: As requested on Discord. Imho that makes sense, as it "clutters" the screen for experienced players who only use the hotkeys anyway.

data.title: Add ArmorTypes to HitShape
data.body:
This allows to assign Armor traits to specific HitShapes, allowing to make certain parts of actors more vulnerable or durable than others.
Can also be used to simulate directional armor in a good-enough way that this closes #7718.

Testcase can be found here: https://github.com/reaperrr/OpenRA/tree/hitshape-armor-test

Closes #9268

data.title: Make tutorial maps for new players
data.body:
New players often get confused about what is happening in the battlefield, and old players that have little or no tolerance left will 70% get mad at them, because some things like kill an enemy engineer that is capturing your construction yard is just to obvious for them, but not for a new player.

Also new players might get frustrated by the RTS idea, examples will be: like "what to do with the car in the start" and "ore? tiberium??? whats all this?" ect.

I strongly believe that in order to keep new players in the game we will need a 4 stage tutorial.

Stage 1:  map 1
Fundamentals of rts gaming, what is a base building, why we need units, how the resource management works, or even how we win the game.

Stage 2: map 1
Learn how to build and what to build, read the descriptions of each unit and building, use of super weapons, gather this amount of resources, use of the radar, complete minor objectives, expand your base, learn the usage of some units and buildings and how to use them when its needed, ect.

Stage 3: map 2
Use what you learn vs Bot, allow the player to recover via scripts (money gift, reinforcements, ect) 
guide him to use advance tactics like use of artillery type units with a combination of air units,  use iron curtain with shock troopers, use chrono on tanks vs the enemy base and mechanics to repair them after they return back, help your AI ally with defenses and money trucks and repair his buildings.

Stage 4: map 2
Multiplayer interaction, beacons, chat short messages (cap=capture, AA=build allied anti air defense here), assist other players, sent money, plan ahead with your ally, be aware of notifications on mini map, combine your forces with your ally forces, be aggressive (don't fear that your enemy has 10 tesla coils on his base, go get that oil derrick that is way far from your base).


Also using a voice tutorial will assist on keeping the player interested on staying, 
objectives could be announced once with a voice notification and continue to notify the player with text notifications at repeated rates.

Providing the player with the link of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Playing-the-game at the end of each tutorial will also be a good idea.
